com.devisubox.dvws.Command

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.devisubox.dvws.Command.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Order, Request

    public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class describing a normalized message composed of said command and its arguments.
    See Also:
    Request, Order

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> arguments
      Array representing the different arguments, all considered to be strings and individually casted by the individual execute() functions.
      java.lang.String command
      The string representing the generic command.
      static java.lang.String commandSeparator
      The token separator used to parse the arguments of a given command.
      SendingThread sendingThread
      Object representing the thread from which the command originated.

      Default constructor for an abstract command.

       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> arguments,
       SendingThread sendingThread)
        Default constructor for an abstract command.

        command - the command, stripped from its arguments
        arguments - the arguments for said command.
        sendingThread - the sending thread handling the command

       SendingThread sendingThread)

        Parameters:
        message - the raw message sent by the client
        sendingThread - the sending thread handling the command
        See Also:
        Request, Order

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public abstract java.lang.Object execute()
        Method that will be executed by the sendingThread when treating the command.
        Returns:
        Either a Map or a List containing the result that will be encoded and sent back to the client

      • isCommand

        public static boolean isCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Method verifying if a given message contains a command, which is either a Request or an Order.
        Parameters:
        command - the raw message sent by the client
        Returns:
        true if the string is a valid command
        See Also:
        Request.isRequest(), Order.isOrder()

      • parseArguments

        Returns:
        the arguments
